title: Support dominant-baseline in text element in SVG
body: <text style="dominant-baseline:text-before-edge" ..> is supported in all major browsers but edge to allow vertically aligning text in SVG.

comments.body: This will never happen, guys. Microsoft hates SVG. Always has. Irrational but there you go.
Strange one to omit - vertical alignment is quite essential in SVG.
If you like SVG, you can vote here as well:
SVG is becoming more and more commonplace in web development, especially with animations. It's insane that IE11/Edge still do not support dominant-baseline or alignment-baseline.
I do not know how to center my text without this property,... everything else is a hack
